Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with green leaves to show it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant with wilting or brown leaves to show it does not have enough water.
The student can illustrate a sun shining to show that plants need light to grow.
The student can represent the soil and roots to demonstrate where plants might get water.
The student can depict both a sunlit plant and one kept in the dark to compare growth and health.
The student can draw different types of plants to observe patterns of growth with and without water.
